definition: to blurt out/to let slip
to persuade
to speak/to say/to explain/to scold/to tell off/a theory (typically the last character in a compound, as in 日心說|日心说 heliocentric theory)
variant of 說|说[shuo1]
to leak/to divulge/to leave out by mistake/waterclock or hourglass (old)
mouth/beak/nozzle/spout (of teapot etc)/CL:張|张[zhang1],個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: Occasionally, by now, Is lipped and called him Scampy.
sentences.chinese: 有时候我说漏嘴，也叫它“小淘气”。

sentences.english: Watch as Marni and Ella try to get him to spill the beans.
sentences.chinese: 观看玛尼和艾拉如何尝试让他说漏嘴的。

sentences.english: We never confided in her, because she would blab.
sentences.chinese: 我们从不跟她说心里话，因她会说漏嘴。

sentences.english: A slip of tongue. " Ardrew said impatiently."
sentences.chinese: “说漏嘴了”，安德鲁不耐烦地说。

sentences.english: When you speak, there may be slips of the tongue.
sentences.chinese: 你说话的时候，有可能说漏嘴。

sentences.english: When you spill the beans, you tell a secret.
sentences.chinese: 你说漏嘴时，也就意味着你在泄密。

sentences.english: Cloth AnYi nearly two presidents Kennedy had the kids spill the beans.
sentences.chinese: 布安姨差点将雅拉甘有过孩子的事说漏嘴。

definition: slip of the tongue/indiscretion/to blurt out a secret
to have loose lips
to leak/to expose (sb's secret)/to spill the beans/to let the cat out of the bag
erhua variant of 露餡|露馅[lou4 xian4]
to confess without being pressed/to make a confession without duress
to blab/to shoot one's mouth off/to commit a gaffe
Trouble issues from the mouth (idiom). A loose tongue may cause a lot of trouble.
lit. mention the pot that doesn't boil (idiom); to touch a sore spot/to talk about sb's weak point
pinyin: na3 hu2 bu4 kai1 ti2 na3 hu2

definition: to reveal the cloven foot (idiom); to unmask one's true nature/to give the game away
to joke/to laugh insincerely/to make merry/to talk irrelevantly
to read smoothly (of text)/to blurt out (without thinking)/to suit one's taste (of food)
to tell a lie
to make a fool of oneself
interruption/to interrupt (esp. talk)/to change the subject
to speak incoherently/to ramble/to talk irresponsibly
the walls have ears (idiom)
